;;坠机现场的消防队员和救援人员。
;

;在一次事故中丧生的 21 名游客的身份 ;威尼斯附近的客车坠毁;已得到证实，其中包括九名乌克兰人、一名来自德国的幼儿和一名正在度蜜月的克罗地亚孕妇。随着意大利老化的道路基础设施引发的争议不断增加，这起事故已得到证实。

;

;这起客车事故是该国过去十年中发生的第二大致命事故，还夺去了来自罗马尼亚的一个四口之家、一对来自葡萄牙的 50 多岁的夫妇、两名年龄分别为 28 岁和 32 岁的德国人、一名来自罗马尼亚的四口之家的生命。南非妇女和意大利司机。

;

;死者中有 5 名儿童，最小的只有 15 个月大。包括三名儿童在内的十五人受伤住院。其中五人仍处于危急状态。

;

;来自克罗地亚的 20 岁新婚夫妇安东内拉·佩尔科维奇 (Antonela Perkovic) 和 25 岁的马尔科·巴科维奇 (Marko Bakovic) 正在意大利度蜜月，威尼斯是此次旅行的最终目的地，其中包括经停罗马、佛罗伦萨和博洛尼亚。巴科维奇是伤者之一。

;

;这辆车龄一年的电动巴士在从威尼斯市中心运往马格拉胡露营公园的途中，突然冲破护栏，车上载有 38 名乘客。然后是立交桥上的栏杆。它从 15 米高的地方坠落，并在梅斯特雷火车站旁边的火车线路旁起火。

;

;主要理论是，司机、40 岁的阿尔贝托·里佐托 (Alberto Rizzotto) 没有被玷污的记录，他犯下了危险的罪行。机动或生病了。威尼斯检察官布鲁诺·切尔奇 (Bruno Cherchi) 表示：“没有刹车的迹象，也没有与其他车辆接触的迹象。”视频片段显示，车辆“沿着护栏滑动了约 50 米”，然后“推开”。向右”并驶离立交桥。 “目击者说他开得很慢，”切尔奇补充道。 “无论如何，那段路一开始都是上坡路，所以客观上来说，它不允许高速行驶。”

;

;护栏是调查的中心，有建议称，护栏是两米长的。生锈的护栏上的“洞”可能是罪魁祸首。

;

;“看到第一张图像后，我立即明白护栏不符合规范，”道路协会负责人多梅尼科·音乐科 (Domenico Musicco) 说事故受害者。 “它很旧，并且有一个不应该存在的间隙，因为中断护栏是违法的。”

;
;

;;相关：;; “他们在度假，就像我们一样”：露营地的客人哀悼威尼斯长途客车事故的受害者;

;
;

;Musicco 表示，如果“新一代”障碍得到解决，这场悲剧本可以避免到位。 Musicco 声称，威尼斯议会在该道路上安装新泽西混凝土护栏的计划进展极其缓慢。 “有些已经就位，但工程尚未到达道路的特定部分，”他说。 “这是意大利真正的问题，缓慢、官僚主义、低效率、懒惰和推卸责任。最终，没有人承担责任。”

;

;威尼斯交通议员雷纳托·博拉索 (Renato Boraso) 驳斥了屏障应归咎于该问题的说法，认为该“漏洞”是“为安全和服务提供的开口”。在最初的设计中”。他告诉意大利媒体：“巴士沿着护栏滑动后，在没有任何刹车或反转向迹象的情况下，从缺口处坠落了 50 米。” “或者我们是否想声称，如果没有‘洞’，护栏能够承受 13 吨重的移动、转向车辆？”

;

;来自极右翼联盟的意大利交通部长马泰奥·萨尔维尼 (Matteo Salvini) 也表示：参与争论，声称事故不是由护栏造成的。他将矛头指向了为公交车提供动力的电池和甲烷气体。

;

;Musicco 援引 2018 年 8 月热那亚莫兰迪大桥倒塌事件，造成 43 人死亡，表示意大利道路基础设施“总体来说很旧”，而且经常缺乏维护。

;

;退休法官卡洛·索尔吉(Carlo Sorgi)表示：“现在判断原因还为时过早，但据我们所知，护栏维护得很差。 ”他补充说，包括莫兰迪大桥在内的之前发生的事件表明，意大利的道路维护普遍“非常缺乏”。

;

;“新冠恢复基金的一些资金将用于道路工程，但我们有一个长期问题这里很慢，”他说。

; Thu, 05 Oct 2023 22:52:01 +0800 It is concerning to watch UK disengage from the world, says Irish PMhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/05/it-is-concerning-to-watch-uk-disengage-from-world-says-irish-pm-leo-varadkar

;;Leo Varadkar 在白色背景前对着麦克风讲话
;

;爱尔兰总理表示他“担心”英国“脱离世界”，并指责英国通过退出欧盟、削减国际援助以及现在考虑放弃人权条约来转向内向。

;

;Leo Varadkar，讲话在西班牙格拉纳达市与英国首相里希·苏纳克举行双边会晤之前，他表示自己几乎无法认出这个国家。

;

;被问到他对英国威胁离开感到担忧时来自欧洲人权公约的他回答道：“说实话。”内政大臣苏埃拉·布雷弗曼 (Suella Braverman) ;质疑该公约是否“符合目的”;。

;

;“我热爱和钦佩的英国和联合王国，是大宪章的国家，是建立了议会民主制，并帮助起草了欧洲人权公约，”瓦拉德卡说道。

;

;“看到英国脱离世界确实让我感到不安——无论是减少国际预算援助，是否离开欧盟，甚至现在谈论退出欧洲人权公约。这不是我认识的英国。”他说。

;

;两位首相是参加欧洲政治共同体第三次峰会的 47 名欧洲领导人之一，这是一个因乌克兰战争而创建的新平台试图忘记非洲大陆各国之间更牢固的联系。

; ;

;瓦拉德拉克表示，他将直接提出人权公约的问题与苏纳克。

;

;他会告诉他，他计划继续立法赦免被控在北爱尔兰问题期间杀人的人，这违反了支持所有人正义的公约。

;

; p>;

;“我们肯定会讨论英国遗产立法的问题。这是爱尔兰政府非常反对的事情，受害者团体也是如此，北爱尔兰的五个主要政党也是如此，[我们]都同意这不是正确的做法。

;

;“我们相信这可能违反了欧洲人权公约，我当然会向总理这么说。”

;

;苏纳克还与意大利总理乔治亚·梅洛尼 (Giorgia Meloni) 举行双边会谈他们都设法将移民问题纳入非官方议程。

;

;苏纳克在参加峰会的路上没有回答问题，估计有 800 名记者出席。

;

;领导人由于要讨论包括乌克兰国防、能源安全和人工智能在内的地缘政治问题，但在第十一小时，英国和意大利首相主持的分组会议增加了移民问题。

;

;欧洲领导人已经团结起来周四在西班牙举行的近 50 位总统和总理会议上，弗拉基米尔·泽连斯基 (Volodymyr Zelenskiy) 表示，与美国不同，;他们永远不会动摇对保卫乌克兰的支持;。

;

;非洲大陆 47 名领导人齐聚一堂，其中包括 17 名非领导人- 欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉·冯德莱恩 (Ursula von der Leyen) 抵达格拉纳达参加会议时表示，欧盟领导人讨论乌克兰问题是一个信息。

;

;“这向普京发出了强烈的信息，从都柏林到“基希讷乌，我们不会容忍针对主权国家的侵略者，”她说。

;

;泽伦斯基周四上午飞往西班牙，讨论保卫国家的问题，以及争取成为欧盟正式成员的问题。

;

;他坚称，暂时将乌克兰国防开支排除在美国预算之外只是暂时现象，在与乔·拜登交谈后，他确信美国“100%”支持乌克兰。

;

;“主要挑战是拯救欧洲的团结，不仅是欧盟，而是整个欧洲，”泽连斯基警告俄罗斯“虚假信息攻击”。

;

;他曾在社交媒体上表示早些时候媒体表示，他的首要任务是加强乌克兰的防空。
;
;“我们将特别关注黑海地区以及我们为加强全球粮食安全和航行自由而共同努力，”他补充道。< /p>;

;;从火车外看到的事件闭路电视录像的剧照
;

;伊朗反对派人士已要求公布事件的完整闭路电视录像，一名目前处于昏迷状态的 16 岁女孩据称在德黑兰地铁与戴头巾的警察发生冲突后倒地。

;

;Armita Geravand 仍在医院周日事件发生后。当局公布了视频，他们称这些视频证实了他们的说法，即阿米塔因血压下降而晕倒，但国外的人权组织声称，她在与特工的对抗中摔倒了，因为她没有戴头巾。

; <图数据- media-id="8cc35e1d4c043565af9fbffb75bb491c31ce8251">; ;伊朗的“道德警察”全国抗议活动 10 个月后恢复巡逻;

; ;

;在周二播出的采访中，艾哈迈迪表示，她的女儿因血压下降而昏倒，但活动人士表示，他们担心她的证词已经上演。

;

;权利团体担心阿米塔可能面临与 ;Mahsa Amini;，一名 22 岁的女性，去年在道德警察拘留期间昏迷死亡，引发了数月的全国抗议。与阿米尼案的另一个相似之处是，《Shargh》报纸的一名试图调查该事件的记者被短暂拘留。

;

;纳尔吉斯·穆罕默迪 (Narges Mohammadi)，一名女权活动人士，在德黑兰埃文监狱服刑 10 年。 ，在 Instagram 上表示，“政府的行为表明其不顾一切地试图阻止真相……被揭露”。

;

;此案已开始引起国际社会的关注，包括德国外交部长安娜莱娜·贝尔博克 (Annalena Baerbock)。推特写道：“#伊朗的一名年轻女性再次为自己的生命而战。就因为她在地铁上露出了头发。令人难以忍受。”

;

;美国伊朗问题副特使艾布拉姆·佩利在推特上表示，他对“所谓的道德警察”袭击阿米塔的报道感到震惊。他补充道：“据报道记者玛丽亚姆·洛特菲在调查这起袭击事件时被捕，这也是不可接受的，也是对新闻自由的侮辱。伊朗政权应该花更多时间担心它如何对待自己的人民，而不是媒体如何报道其暴行”。 近几个月来，伊朗已将道德警察重新带回街头，并且立法者正在推动对那些藐视头巾要求的人实施更严厉的处罚。

;

;Hengaw 声称，在阿姆里特受伤的德黑兰地铁站负责监管戴头巾的保安人员没有上班，但他们没有上班可以独立确认这一点。她被送往附近的 Fajr 医院，该医院目前戒备森严。

;

;伊朗外交部发言人纳赛尔·卡纳尼 (Nasser Kanani) 将西方国家对伊朗妇女处境的担忧描述为“干涉主义、偏见和偏见”。 ”。

;

;伊朗仅存的几家独立报纸，在日益严格的审查之下，没有广泛报道所发生的事情，但改革派报纸《Etemaad》要求政府解释为何记者被阻止执行他们的任务。寻求真相是宪法义务。

;

;教师工会在周三的一份声明中表示，教育部安全主管曾访问阿米塔的学校并威胁她的老师。 “他强调，阿米塔·杰拉万德的老师在社交媒体上分享阿米塔·杰拉万德的任何新闻或照片都将导致巨额罚款，并立即终止他们的合同，”工会表示。

; Thu, 05 Oct 2023 21:52:02 +0800 Picasso portrait of Marie-Thérèse Walter expected to reach $120m at auctionhttps://www.theguardian.com/artanddesign/2023/oct/05/picasso-portrait-of-marie-therese-walter-expected-to-reach-120m-at-auction
;;2023-10-05T13:18:29Z;
;
;;一位参观者正在观看 9 月份在迪拜苏富比拍卖行展出的巴勃罗·毕加索的《女人》。
;

;时间似乎是 7.25，年份肯定是 1932 年。巴勃罗·毕加索 (Pablo Picasso)，20 世纪艺术界的杰出人物，为他的“黄金缪斯”和秘密情人玛丽-泰蕾兹·沃尔特 (Marie-Thérèse Walter) 画了一幅肖像，这是众多肖像之一。

;

;尽管毕加索对钟表着迷并拥有几件美丽而昂贵的作品，但这是毕加索仅有的三件以手表为主题的主要作品之一。

;

;肖像《Femme à la》 Montre，将从周六开始在伦敦首次展出，为期五天，然后下个月由苏富比拍卖行拍卖。它的估价超过 1.2 亿美元（9900 万英镑）。

;

;毕加索在他爆炸性的“奇迹之年”期间画了《Femme à la Montre》，当时他正准备在巴黎举办他的第一次大型回顾展。 50 岁。

;

;他与沃尔特的关系已经密切了好几年，这种关系始于这位 45 岁的艺术家透过巴黎老佛爷百货公司的橱窗发现了这位 17 岁的年轻人。她为绘画、素描和雕塑提供了灵感，其中一些作品被认为是毕加索八十年职业生涯中最伟大的作品。

;

;《蒙特的女人》以鲜艳的色彩绘制，展示了沃尔特的坐姿和侧面。她的手腕上戴着一块表盘简洁、表带亮黄色的手表。

; ;

;“毕加索充满激情，但这种（对手表的）特殊热情并不为人所知，”苏富比全球美术副主席西蒙·肖 (Simon Shaw) 说道。

;

;“他是一个非常时尚的男人，对自己的着装身份非常感兴趣。也是一位伟大的手表鉴赏家。甚至他佩戴手表的照片也受到手表收藏家的珍视。”

;

;毕加索拥有的手表包括 20 世纪 40 年代末的积家三日期月相表、1950 年代的百达翡丽月相表和 1960 年代的劳力士 GMT-师父。

;

;根据肖的说法，在这幅肖像中，沃尔特被描绘成“加冕的圣母”。到 1932 年，她已经成为毕加索的情人五年了，两人向毕加索的妻子奥尔加隐瞒了他们的关系。 “我认为这块手表与 [毕加索和沃尔特] 偷来的在一起时光有关 - 尽管她现在已经是一个公开的秘密。”

;

;这幅肖像画由最伟大的艺术收藏家之一艾米丽·费舍尔·兰道 (Emily Fisher Landau) 于 1968 年购买20世纪。她把它挂在纽约公寓客厅的壁炉架上方。今年早些时候，当她 102 岁去世时，她的艺术收藏品可能已经装满了几个博物馆。

;

;在一名窃贼偷走钻石、祖母绿、红宝石和蓝宝石后，Fisher Landau 开始认真收藏艺术品。是她丈夫送的礼物。费舍尔·兰道没有更换珠宝，而是决定用大额保险金购买绘画和雕塑。

;

;她购买了马克·罗斯科、弗兰兹·克莱恩、亨利·马蒂斯、乔治亚·欧姬芙、皮特·蒙德里安、保罗的作品。克利等人。安迪·沃霍尔为她画了肖像。

;

;“她是一位极其重要的文化人物，是美国当代艺术真正的领跑者，”肖说。

;

;在她去世后，费舍尔·兰道的女儿，坎迪亚·费舍尔 (Candia Fisher) 承诺向纽约惠特尼美国艺术博物馆捐赠数百件作品，该收藏家曾是该博物馆的受托人。

;

;大约 120 件艺术品将于 11 月 8 日在纽约苏富比拍卖行拍卖。拍卖价格可达 5 亿英镑。

;

;Shaw 表示，《Femme à la Montre》是一幅“非常令人向往、非常特别”的画作。即便如此，它也不太可能打破;毕加索在 2015 年凭借《阿尔及尔女性》（版本“O”）创下了近 1.8 亿美元的纪录;。

; Thu, 05 Oct 2023 21:52:02 +0800 Jon Fosse wins the 2023 Nobel prize in literaturehttps://www.theguardian.com/books/2023/oct/05/jon-fosse-wins-the-2023-nobel-prize-in-literature

;
;;乔恩·福斯。
;

;;诺贝尔文学奖;已授予 64 岁的挪威作家;乔恩·福斯;“因为他的创新戏剧和散文表达了不可言说”。他的作品包括;七神论; 系列小说，《火焰中的阿利斯》、《忧郁》和《闪灵》。

;

;“他的巨著作品涵盖多种流派，包括大约 40 部戏剧和大量小说、诗集、散文、儿童读物和翻译，”诺贝尔文学委员会主席安德斯·奥尔森说。 “福斯将其挪威背景的语言和本质与现代主义之后的艺术技巧融为一体。”

;

;福斯的小说出版商雅克·泰斯塔德 (Jacques Testard) 听到这一消息后表示：“他是一位杰出的作家，他成功地找到了一种完全独特的小说写作方式。正如他的挪威编辑 Cecilie Seiness 最近在接受采访时所说，如果你打开乔恩的任何一本书并读几行，它不可能是其他人写的。

;

;“他的小说是咒语，神秘，植根于他长大的西部峡湾的风景，”他补充道。 “重要的是要记住，他用新挪威语或新挪威语写作，这是挪威的一种少数民族语言，这本身就是一种政治行为。他也是一位杰出的剧作家和诗人。福斯 1959 年出生于挪威西海岸的海于格松，在斯特兰德巴姆长大。七岁时，他差点在一场事故中丧生，他说这是他童年“最重要的经历”，也是“造就”他成为一名艺术家的经历。在青春期时，他立志成为一名摇滚吉他手，随后将志向转向写作。

;

;他的处女作小说《Raudt, svart》（《红，黑》）于 1983 年出版。 1994 年，他创作的第一部戏剧《Og aldri skal vi Skilljast》（《我们永不分离》）在卑尔根国家剧院上演。然而，他创作的第一部戏剧《Nokon kjem til å komme》（《有人要来》） ），这为他带来了突破，1999 年，法国导演克劳德·雷吉 (Claude Régy) 在楠泰尔 (Nanterre) 上演了该剧。

;

;福斯创作了 30 多部戏剧，包括 Namnet（《名字》）、Vinter（《冬天》）和Ein sommars dag（“夏日”）。他的长篇作品包括《七宗论》三部曲，其中第三卷入围 2022 年国际布克奖。

;

;《七宗论》是福斯在暂停剧作家生涯并于 2013 年皈依天主教后开始创作的，讲述的是一位年迈的画家阿斯勒独自生活在挪威西南海岸，反思自己的生活。在比约格温住着另一个阿斯勒，他也是一名画家，但与酗酒作斗争。这两个分身都被同样的关于死亡、信仰和爱的存在问题所困扰。

;法国总统，;埃马纽埃尔·马克龙 (Emmanuel Macron) 9 月 24 日表示，法国将撤军，因为它不会“被武士分子扣为人质”。尼日尔的前殖民国家继续支持巴祖姆，巴黎官员表示，当毛派统治该国时，不可能继续与尼日尔军队联合行动打击叛乱分子。马克龙称军政府为“混乱的盟友”。

;

;法国军队已驻扎尼日尔，作为打击萨赫勒地区圣战分子的更广泛斗争的一部分，巴黎处于打击该地区伊斯兰叛乱分子行动的最前沿。地区十年。

;

;

;撤军的决定给西方打击该地区伊斯兰叛乱的努力留下了一个漏洞，并达成了协议对法国影响力的打击可能会让俄罗斯扩大在该地区的影响力。 Until the coup, Niger had been the west's last key ally in the central Sahel region south of the Sahara.

;

;The coup is seen as the latest serious threat to French strategy in the Sahel, after several military coups in other countries had already forced Paris to rethink its military presence and anti-jihadist mission.

;

;France first deployed troops against jihadists in Mali in 2013 under the Socialist president François Hollande, but in the past three years several military coups in the region, as well as a continued jihadist presence, have exposed the limitations of the military strategy and forced France to scale back its presence and focus its efforts in Niger, with Bazoum as a firm ally.

; ;

;;In Mali a coup in 2020; led to a diplomatic standoff with France, ;which withdrew its troops last year;. France also quit Burkina Faso after two coups last year brought in a junta that adopted a nationalist line. ;

;Last month, Macron said he was “very worried” about the region, saying that jihadist attacks were causing dozens of deaths a day in Mali and such assaults had resumed in Niger.

;Macron has said that era is over but acknowledged there was more to be done to boost Paris's relationship with African countries.

; Thu, 05 Oct 2023 20:22:02 +0800 Closure of maternity wards fuels Chinese debate over population declinehttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/05/closure-of-maternity-wards-fuels-chinese-debate-over-population-decline
;;2023-10-05T11:47:14Z;
;
;;Pregnant women working out during a fitness class at an obstetrics and gynecology hospital in Shijiazhuang.
;

;A number of hospital obstetrics units in China have closed, prompting discussion about the effects of China's dramatically falling birth rate.

;

;Several hospitals in Zhejiang province have reportedly closed or downsized their obstetrics units, along with hospitals in Jiangsu and Guangdong.

;

;China's birth rate fell to a record low in 2022, with just 9.56m births, a drop of nearly 10% compared with 2021. That meant the population ;shrank; for the first time since 1961, a year of mass famine in China. The slump is fuelling a demographic crisis in China, with an ageing and shrinking population that threatens to derail the country's GDP growth. This year India officially overtook China ;to become the world's most populous country;.

;

;China's leaders are ;keenly aware; of the problems caused by a greying population, and officials have introduced a ;range of measures; to try and boost the birth rate. The one child policy was scrapped in 2016, with families now allowed to have up to three children. With young people increasingly putting off or deciding against childrearing altogether, the three child policy is more of an ambition than a limit. Sichuan province has abandoned limits on birth registration altogether. Some local authorities offer cash subsidies for second and third children.

;

;These policies have had little impact on the birth rate, which is in stubborn decline. The number of new births a year has nearly halved since 2016. Young women in particular often feel that the costs of raising a child are too high and that their own economic prospects are gloomy, not to mention that of the next generation. Urban, educated women are also increasingly resistant to accept the patriarchal family norms that come with having a child.

;

;The recent hospital closures have not been officially linked to falling birth rates. In April, a health centre in Guangxi province said that it would stop offering deliveries in the obstetrics and gynaecology unit because of the increasing number of high-risk pregnancies in the district. Last month, the Second hospital of Yinzhou, a district in the eastern city of Ningbo, announced that it would no longer be offering maternal diagnosis and treatment services. The local health bureau later clarified that the obstetrics unit was being integrated with a newly-built women's and children's health centre at the Affiliated People's hospital of Ningbo University, about 6 miles away. The bureau said that the number of obstetrics beds in Yinzhou had increased to 237 between 2022 and 2023.

;

;In some cases, hospitals blamed a lack of staff rather than a lack of babies for the winding down of obstetrics services, which cover pregnancy, childbirth and the postpartum period. Two clinics in Huizhou, and one in Guangzhou, have suspended overnight services in their maternal health wards because of a lack of obstetricians and gynaecologists, according to ;the Paper;.

;

;But several online commentaries have linked the news to China's population struggles. In an article published on NetEase, a Chinese content provider, a blogger with the username “Say it quickly” wrote: “The deserted obstetrics departments means that fewer women are getting pregnant … [China's] newborn population has been declining in recent years, and the situation is not optimistic”.

;

;One obstetrician from the Harbin maternal and child care hospital told ;Chinese media;: “In the past, the number of births might have been seven or eight, or 10 in a day, now it can be one every few days. If there is one a day, that's great.”

;

;;Additional research by Chi Hui Lin;

; Thu, 05 Oct 2023 19:52:01 +0800 US representative files resolution decrying rightwing calls for invasion of Mexicohttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/05/joaquin-castro-military-action-mexico-fentanyl-republican
;;2023-10-05T11:00:11Z;
;
;;Joaquin Castro in front of a microphone.
;

;A progressive US congressman from ;Texas; has asked his legislative colleagues to join him in condemning some American conservatives' calls to invade Mexico – ostensibly to do battle with drug cartels there.

;
;

;;Related: ;;US announces sanctions against 14 foreign companies for importing fentanyl;

;
;

;;Joaquin Castro; says he intends to file a resolution in the US House as soon as Friday reaffirming the federal government's “commitment to respecting the sovereignty of Mexico and condemning calls for military action without Mexico's consent and congressional authorization”.

;

;The San Antonio Democrat and House foreign affairs committee member's proposed measure – a copy of which was provided to the Guardian – comes after a high-profile episode in May saw ;US senator John Kennedy urge the US to send its military into Mexico; to confront drug cartels.

;

;In the process, Kennedy insulted Mexicans by saying they “would be eating cat food out of a can and living in a tent behind an Outback” steakhouse restaurant if it were not for their proximity to the US. The racist remarks earned the Louisiana Republican criticism from Mexico's top government leaders as well as many of his compatriots.

;

;The resolution from Castro, who's served in the House since 2013, also seeks to assert that the US and Mexico “have cooperated for several decades on a variety of issues such as trade, investment, counter-narcotics, migration, rule of law and security, including through recent high-level security and economic dialogues”.

;

;Castro's resolution is not a bill and therefore would not have the force of law if the House passes it. Nonetheless, such measures can have meaningful symbolic value.

;

;In a statement to the Guardian on Thursday, Castro said it was important not to “normalize the idea of invading Mexico”.

;

;“War with Mexico would cause devastating loss of life and would be disastrous for millions of Mexicans and Americans living in Mexico, as well as those in the US whose livelihoods depend on legitimate cross-border trade,” said the statement from Castro, who identifies as Mexican American. “This resolution sends a strong message that the United States respects Mexico's sovereignty and that Congress does not support dangerous calls for war at our southern border.”

;

;Republican rhetoric that exalts the idea of charging into Mexico with the US military centers in part on Mexican cartels' pressing illegal fentanyl into counterfeit pills, which are designed to look like Xanax, oxycodone, Percocet and other prescription medications.

;

;Many of the 70,000 or so overdose deaths reported in the US annually involve people who ingested fentanyl without realizing it.

;

;Mexico maintains that many of its government officials as well as citizens have sacrificed their lives in the name of stopping fentanyl from flowing across the country's borders.

;

;And Mexican leaders have suggested that US conservatives shouldn't be so quick to contemplate invading Mexico as a solution to the fentanyl crisis. Instead, they say, the US could do more to block its residents from obtaining fentanyl simply by going for a short drive to meet dealers, who are often American-born, or logging on to certain websites.

;

;The non-profit Friends Committee on National Legislation echoed some aspects of that position in a statement supporting Castro's resolution. “Responding to the fentanyl epidemic with military force would militarize a public health challenge for which treatment and health services are desperately needed to help those suffering from drug dependence,” said a statement from the committee's foreign policy director, Heather Brandon-Smith.

;

;Cosponsors of Castro's measure include Democratic representatives Nydia Velázquez of New York, Jesús “Chuy” Garcia of Illinois, Ilhan Omar of Minnesota and Rashida Tlaib of Michigan. It would require a simple House majority to ratify the resolution.

;

;Democrats for now hold 212 seats, and Republicans have 222. That means Castro's resolution would stand a strong chance of succeeding with his fellow Democrats' support and only a handful of Republican defections.

;

;It's unclear when the resolution may get to a vote after Republican House speaker Kevin McCarthy's removal from the role on Tuesday. The House must select a replacement speaker for its business to substantially resume, and the chamber was expected to be in recess for the rest of the week.

;“We were close friends,” Yedidia said. They lived together at times and worked together, he said, which at one point came to include at FTX.

;

;Yedidia said he last saw Bankman-Fried in November 2022 and had not spoken to him since. ;“After you learned that, what did you do?” the prosecutor Danielle Sassoon asked.

;“I resigned,” Yedidia said.

;Yedidia was asked why he was testifying with an immunity order.

;The trader who testified, Marc-Antoine Julliard, explained how Bankman-Fried projected positivity, which helped woo him to the platform. Julliard said he learned about FTX from a friend and searched FTX online, poring over Google results and social media.

;

;“I was about to commit significant amounts of money to trading cryptocurrency, and I wanted to be sure,” Julliard testified.

;

;He started to follow FTX and Bankman-Fried's Twitter accounts and opened an FTX account in spring 2021.

;

;“He would come across to me as the future face of the general crypto industry,” Julliard said.

;

;His testimony about extensive advertising and public relations was meant to demonstrate how unsuspecting FTX investors dumped their money into the exchange by seeing respected, familiar faces on ads, including celebrities. ;

;He wound up changing his mind a day later, but when asked whether he was ever able to withdraw any money, he replied: “Never.”

;New legislation to revitalise Peru's film industry has been proposed after the makers of the British comedy Paddington in Peru chose Colombia as the main filming location for the movie about the bear's return to his home country.

;

;The initiative, put forward by rightwing lawmaker Adriana Tudela, cited the “lack of incentives and the high number of national and local bureaucratic barriers to filming in Peru” as the principal obstacle to the mislocation of the third Paddington movie due out in 2024.

;

;But the proposal has sparked outrage among Peruvian film-makers because it would cap subsidies for Indigenous and regional film-makers and reversing a policy of positive discrimination enshrined in an existing law.

;

;Tudela's bill sets out a 50% cap on state incentives for the total cost of production of national films, a move industry insiders describe as an attack cultural diversity that would cripple the country's award-winning Indigenous cinema.

;

;“I do believe there are good Peruvian films,” Tudela told ;El Comercio; newspaper. “But the market needs to be much more dynamic … in order to have an industry that is self-sustainable and does not depend solely on subsidies.”

;

;Peru's ministry of culture has dismissed the bill as “;unviable;”, adding that the government “recognises the cultural diversity of the country and values and encourages the participation of indigenous or native populations”.

;

;“If they knew this industry, if they knew the inequalities that exist between Lima and the provinces, they would realise that government support is very important – and that it has borne fruit in the last few years,” said Josué Mendéz, an award-winning Peruvian film director.

;
;

;;Related: ;;'Time has created distance': Peru's film-makers take on country's long conflict;

;
;

;“To erase all the cinema that is made in the regions and allow only one type of cinema from Lima, in Spanish, would cancel a large part of the identity of the country,” said Mendéz, whose feature film ;El Caso Monroy; was partially funded by the culture ministry and opens in local cinemas this week.

; ;

;Film-makers say the existing 2019 law allows national cinema to reach goals that have been achieved by neighbouring countries, such as Chile and Colombia, thanks to state backing of around $6.8m.

;

;Rightwing congressman Alejandro Cavero provoked particular ire last week when he described Peruvian films as “very bad” when voicing his support for the bill, adding: “Economic stimuli is distributed and I don't see a single film that has won absolutely anything.”

;

;Among the award-winning Peruvian films that depict indigenous culture, Retablo (2017) won more than 20 international awards including a Berlin Teddy for Best Newcomer and a Bafta nomination; Wiñaypacha (2016) the first Peruvian film entirely the Aymara language, won awards in the Guadalajara film festival. Willaq Pirqa, which tells the story of a 13-year-old boy in a Quechua-speaking village in Cusco who discovers the magic of cinema, was a box-office success in Peru last year.

;

;In 2010, ;La Teta Asustada; (Milk of Sorrow), directed by Claudia Llosa, became the first Peruvian film to be nominated for an Oscar in the best foreign film category.

;

;“There is always going to be a sector in politics that wants to control the narrative,” said Mendéz. “This is an attack on culture and it is up to us to defend it.”
